result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Surita

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases called 15CF173, 15CF181.  Defendant Michael A. Surita in court with attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews stipulation, charges and penalties.  DE pleads Guilty to counts 1 and 2, Mr. Surita withdraws those pleas.  DE pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2 of case 15CF173, as amended.  Court reviews PQWOR with defendant.  Court finds factual basis, finds pleas made FVKI, accepts plea and finds guilty of counts 1 and 2 on case 15CF173, Case 15CF181 is DRI.  Atty. Sempf is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Wolter is heard.  Defendant makes statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

Sentence withheld,
Probation for 18 months with conditions:
Costs/fees,
restitution in the amount of $193.80.

Bond in the 15CF181 - restitution should be taken out of that, remaining amount should go toward costs.

Called cases 15CF173 and 15CF181. Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter appeared. Defendant Michael A. Surita not in court. Prosecuting Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wolter heard on def non-appearance. Court heard, will reschedule hearing and notice to be sent.

15CF173 & 181: Defendant Michael A. Surita in court with attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:15 - Defendant Michael A. Surita in court, in custody with attorney Jessica M. Moeller (not eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
